inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: diagnosis of asthma for the asthma cohort: Subjects must have asthma according to one or more of the following criteria documented in the last 12 months

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: improvement in FEV1 ≥ 12% and 200ml predicted after inhalation of 400 mcg salbutamol

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: diurnal variation in PEF: amplitude % mean of twice daily PEF > 8%

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: treatment with one or more of the following drugs: inhaled corticosteroids, oral corticosteroids, long-acting beta-agonists, long-acting beta-agonists and short-acting beta-agonists

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: PLUS a history of wheeze occurring spontaneously or on exertion

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: Current smoker, or Ex-smoker with a >10 year pack history or having smoked within the past 6 months

exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Significant alternative diagnoses that may mimic or complicate asthma, in particular dysfunctional breathing, panic attacks, and overt psychosocial problems (if these are thought to be the major problem rather than in addition to severe asthma)

exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: Significant other primary pulmonary disorders in particular pulmonary embolism, pulmonary hypertension, interstitial lung disease and lung cancer

exclusion.criterion: diagnosis or current investigation of occupational asthma
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: Diagnosis or current investigation of occupational asthma

notes: Patient has a history of wheezing and is currently using inhaled corticosteroids and fluticasone. However, they have been experiencing symptoms for the past 5 days despite doubling their oral corticosteroids.
